title: Datasets in geofi-package
text: 2022 new data source introduced provides municipality borders municipality population data. Spatial data provided 1:4 500 000 scale. Calling function year = 2019 returns population data 2019-12-31 spatial data borders 2020. statistical variables data : total population (vaesto), share total population (vaesto_p), number men (miehet), men’s share population area (miehet_p) women (naiset), women’s share (naiset_p), aged 15: number (ika_0_14), share (ika_0_14p), aged 15 64: number (ika_15_64), share (ika_15_64p), aged 65 : number (ika_65_), share (ika_65_p). plot men’s share municipality level 2020 (2021 municipality borders) can simply .  Aggregating absolute population numbers straightforward: plot population Wellbeing service county level can .  plot men’s share wellbeing service country level add one step
code: get_municipality_pop(year = 2022) |>     subset(select = miehet_p) |>    plot() get_municipality_pop(year = 2022) |>     group_by(hyvinvointialue_name_fi) |>     summarise(vaesto = sum(vaesto)) |>     select(vaesto) |>    plot() get_municipality_pop(year = 2022) |>     dplyr::group_by(hyvinvointialue_name_fi) |>    summarise(vaesto = sum(vaesto),             miehet = sum(miehet)) |>    mutate(share = miehet/vaesto*100) |>    select(share) |>    plot()

title: Datasets in geofi-package
text: Ryan Hafen’s blog: geofacet package extends ggplot2 way makes easy create geographically faceted visualizations R. geofacet take data representing different geographic entities apply visualization method data entity, resulting set visualizations laid grid mimics original geographic topology closely possible. geofi-package contains custom grids used various Finnish administrative breakdowns listed . example population data municipality level pulled THL 2000 2022, aggregated levels regions (maakunta) plotted ggplot2 using grid geofi::grid_maakunta. Population data provided part geofi package geofi::sotkadata_population.
code: d <- data(package = "geofi") as_tibble(d$results) |>    select(Item,Title) |>      filter(grepl("grid", Item)) |>    print(n = 100) #> # A tibble: 22 × 2 #>    Item                   Title                                                  #>    <chr>                  <chr>                                                  #>  1 grid_ahvenanmaa        custom geofacet grid for Ahvenanmaa region             #>  2 grid_etela_karjala     custom geofacet grid for Etelä-Karjala region as in 2… #>  3 grid_etela_pohjanmaa   custom geofacet grid for Etelä-Pohjanmaa               #>  4 grid_etela_savo        custom geofacet grid for Etelä-Savo                    #>  5 grid_hyvinvointialue   custom geofacet grid for Wellbeing services counties   #>  6 grid_kainuu            custom geofacet grid for Kainuu region                 #>  7 grid_kanta_hame        custom geofacet grid for Kanta-Häme region             #>  8 grid_keski_pohjanmaa   custom geofacet grid for Keski-Pohjanmaa region        #>  9 grid_keski_suomi       custom geofacet grid for Keski-Suomi region as in 2020 #> 10 grid_kymenlaakso       custom geofacet grid for Kymenlaakso region            #> 11 grid_lappi             custom geofacet grid for Lappi region as in 2020       #> 12 grid_maakunta          custom geofacet grid for regions                       #> 13 grid_paijat_hame       custom geofacet grid for Päijät-Häme region            #> 14 grid_pirkanmaa         custom geofacet grid for Pirkanmaa region              #> 15 grid_pohjanmaa         custom geofacet grid for Pohjanmaa region              #> 16 grid_pohjois_karjala   custom geofacet grid for Pohjois-Karjala region        #> 17 grid_pohjois_pohjanmaa custom geofacet grid for Pohjois-Pohjanmaa region      #> 18 grid_pohjois_savo      custom geofacet grid for Pohjois-Savo region           #> 19 grid_sairaanhoitop     custom geofacet grid for health care districts         #> 20 grid_satakunta         custom geofacet grid for Satakunta region              #> 21 grid_uusimaa           custom geofacet grid for Uusimaa region                #> 22 grid_varsinais_suomi   custom geofacet grid for Varsinais-Suomi region # Let pull population data from THL sotkadata <- geofi::sotkadata_population  # lets aggregate population data dat <- left_join(geofi::municipality_key_2023 |> select(-year),                  sotkadata) |>    group_by(maakunta_code, maakunta_name_fi,year) |>    summarise(population = sum(primary.value, na.rm = TRUE)) |>    na.omit() |>    ungroup() |>    rename(code = maakunta_code, name = maakunta_name_fi)  library(geofacet) library(ggplot2)  ggplot(dat, aes(x = year, y = population/1000, group = name)) +    geom_line() +    facet_geo(facets = ~name, grid = grid_maakunta, scales = "free_y") +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 6)) +   scale_x_discrete(breaks = seq.int(from = 2000, to = 2023, by = 5)) +   labs(title = unique(sotkadata$indicator.title.fi), y = "%")

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: geofi package provides tools geocoding reverse geocoding Finnish place names, street addresses, geographic coordinates using National Land Survey Finland (NLS) geocoding REST API. vignette demonstrates use geocode() geocode_reverse() functions : Geocode: Convert textual location descriptions (e.g., place names street addresses) spatial coordinates. Reverse Geocode: Convert geographic coordinates textual location descriptions (e.g., place names addresses). functions designed researchers, analysts, developers working spatial data Finland, offering robust error handling integration sf package spatial data manipulation.

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: use NLS geocoding API, need API key National Land Survey Finland. Follow steps: Visit NLS API key instructions page. Register log obtain personal API key. Store API key securely, used authenticate requests.

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Install geofi package GitHub (CRAN, available): Load package required dependencies:
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("rOpenGov/geofi") # Install from CRAN install.packages("geofi") library(geofi) library(sf) library(ggplot2)

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Set API key using options() function. Replace “your_api_key_here” actual API key: Alternatively, can pass API key directly api_key parameter function call, setting globally convenient.

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: geocode() function converts place names street addresses spatial coordinates, returning sf object point geometries. supports multiple data sources (e.g., geographic names, addresses) output coordinate reference systems (CRS: EPSG:3067 EPSG:4326).

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Let’s geocode place name “Suomenlinna,” famous sea fortress Helsinki, using geographic-names source: returns sf object coordinates Suomenlinna EPSG:4326 (WGS84). results found, empty sf object returned warning.
code: suomenlinna <- geocode(   search_string = "Suomenlinna",   source = "geographic-names",   crs = 4326 ) print(suomenlinna)

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Geocode specific street address, “Mannerheimintie 100, Helsinki” limit 5 results: returns sf object EPSG:3067 (ETRS-TM35FIN), suitable Finnish spatial data analysis.
code: address <- geocode(   search_string = "Mannerheimintie 100, Helsinki",   source = "addresses",   crs = 3067,   size = 5 ) print(address)

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Visualize geocoded address map using ggplot2:
code: ggplot(data = address) +   geom_sf(color = "blue", size = 3) +   labs(     title = "Geocoded Location: Mannerheimintie 100, Helsinki",     subtitle = "CRS: ETRS-TM35FIN (EPSG:3067)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: can refine geocoding results using additional parameters: lang: Set response language (“fi”, “sv”, “en”). options: Pass custom API options, focusing search near specific point:

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: geocode_reverse() function converts geographic coordinates (sf POINT objects EPSG:4326) place names addresses. supports multiple points, customizable search radii, different output formats (sf JSON).

what: Example 3: Reverse Geocoding a Single Point
title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Reverse geocode coordinates Parliament House, Helsinki (approximately 60.1725°N, 24.933333°E): returns sf object place name coordinates EPSG:4326.
code: # Create an sf point parliament_point <- data.frame(lon = 24.933333, lat = 60.1725) |>   sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326)  # Reverse geocode places <- geocode_reverse(   point = parliament_point,   sources = "geographic-names" ) print(places)

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: debugging custom processing, return raw JSON responses:
code: json_results <- geocode_reverse(   point = parliament_point,   boundary_circle_radius = 1,   return = "json" ) print(json_results)

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: Plot reverse geocoded results alongside input points:
code: ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = parliament_point, color = "red", size = 3, shape = 17) +   geom_sf(data = places, color = "blue", size = 3) +   labs(     title = "Reverse Geocoded Location: Eduskuntatalo",     subtitle = "Red: Input Point, Blue: Geocoded Result (EPSG:4326)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: API Key Security: Store API key environment variable secure configuration file rather hardcoding scripts. Rate Limits: NLS API may impose rate limits. functions handle HTTP 429 errors retrying delay, avoid excessive requests. Input Validation: Ensure inputs correctly formatted (e.g., sf objects geocode_reverse() must EPSG:4326). CRS Considerations: Use EPSG:3067 Finnish spatial analysis EPSG:4326 global compatibility web mapping. Combining Functions: can chain geocode() geocode_reverse() round-trip testing (e.g., geocode address, reverse geocode coordinates).

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: API Dependency: functions rely NLS geocoding API, requires internet connection valid API key. Coverage: Results limited Finland depend API’s data sources (e.g., geographic names, addresses). Precision: Geocoding accuracy varies source input specificity. Use size boundary_circle_radius refine results. Performance: Reverse geocoding multiple points can slow due individual API requests. Consider batch processing large datasets.

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: NLS Geocoding API Documentation: https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/kartat-ja-paikkatieto/aineistot-ja-rajapinnat/paikkatietojen-rajapintapalvelut/geokoodauspalvelu API Key Instructions: https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/en/rajapinnat/api-avaimen-ohje geofi Package Repository: https://github.com/rOpenGov/geofi sf Package: advanced spatial data manipulation (CRAN).

title: Geocoding and Reverse Geocoding with the geofi Package
text: geofi package simplifies geocoding reverse geocoding Finnish spatial data, leveraging NLS geocoding API. geocode() geocode_reverse(), users can seamlessly convert textual locations coordinates, enabling applications urban planning, geographic analysis, . Try examples data, explore package’s flexibility suit needs.

title: Joining attribute data with geofi data
text: Municipality data provided get_municipalities()-function contains 77 indicators variables 309 municipalities. Variables can used either aggregating data keys joining attribute data.

title: Joining attribute data with geofi data
text: first example join municipality level indicators Swedish-speaking population year end Sotkanet population data, Dataset provided part geofi package geofi::sotkadata_swedish_speaking_pop. obvious , municipality names Finnish among regional breakdowns allows us combine data spatial data using municipality_name_fi-variable. Now can plot map showing Share Swedish-speakers population, % Share foreign citizens population, % two panels sharing scale.
code: library(geofi) muni <- get_municipalities(year = 2023)  library(dplyr) sotkadata_swedish_speaking_pop <- geofi::sotkadata_swedish_speaking_pop map_data <- right_join(muni,                         sotkadata_swedish_speaking_pop,                         by = c("municipality_code" = "municipality_code")) library(ggplot2) map_data |>    ggplot(aes(fill = primary.value)) +    geom_sf() +    labs(title = unique(sotkadata_swedish_speaking_pop$indicator.title.fi)) +   theme(legend.position = "top")

title: Joining attribute data with geofi data
text: can download data Paavo (Open data postal code area) using pxweb-package. example use dataset can downloaded preformatted csv format directly Statistics Finland. Population data provided part geofi package geofi::statfi_zipcode_population. can join data, must extract numerical postal code postal_code_area-variable.
code: statfi_zipcode_population <- geofi::statfi_zipcode_population # Lets join with spatial data and plot the area of each zipcode zipcodes19 <- get_zipcodes(year = 2019)  zipcodes_map <- left_join(zipcodes19,                            statfi_zipcode_population) ggplot(zipcodes_map) +    geom_sf(aes(fill = X2022),            color  = alpha("white", 1/3)) +   labs(title = "Total number of inhabitants, 2022",         fill = NULL)

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: Lets start latest municipality division get_municipalities() POLYGON data POINT data returned municipality_central_localities() function. come CRS EPSG:3067 can plotted together without manipulation.
code: library(geofi) polygon <- get_municipalities(year = 2021, scale = 4500) point <- geofi::municipality_central_localities() # municipality code into integer point$municipality_code <- as.integer(point$kuntatunnus)

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: two main technologies creating static graphics R: base ggplot2. can used plot spatial data ie. create maps. addition, tmap : thematic maps R great tool want dig deeper cartography R. base  ggplot2  tmap tmap versatile library creating static thematic maps R. supports sf-class objects fully compatible geospatial data available geofi. fluent using ggplot2 complex examples using ggplot2-package.
code: library(sf) plot(st_geometry(polygon["municipality_code"])) plot(polygon["municipality_code"], add = TRUE, border="white") plot(st_geometry(point["municipality_code"]), add = TRUE, color = "black") library(ggplot2) ggplot() +    geom_sf(data = polygon, aes(fill = municipality_code)) +   geom_sf(data = point)

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: ggplot2-packages three sf-class spesific functions: geom_sf plotting points, lines polygons, geom_sf_text geom_sf_label labeling maps. following examples using Uusimaa region Southern Finland.
code: library(dplyr) polygon_uusimaa <- polygon |> filter(maakunta_name_fi %in% "Uusimaa") point_uusimaa <- point |> filter(municipality_code %in% polygon_uusimaa$municipality_code) ggplot() +    theme_light() +   geom_sf(data = polygon_uusimaa, alpha = .3) +    geom_sf(data = point_uusimaa) +    geom_sf_text(data = point_uusimaa, aes(label = teksti))

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: geom_sf_label geom_sf_text control overlapping labels common issue mapping objects various shapes sizes. ggrepel can solve problem though requires bit spatial data processing sf-package.
code: ggplot() +    theme_light() +   geom_sf(data = polygon_uusimaa, alpha = .3) +    geom_sf(data = point_uusimaa) +    ggrepel::geom_text_repel(data = point_uusimaa |>                         sf::st_set_geometry(NULL) |>                         bind_cols(point_uusimaa |>                                      sf::st_centroid() |>                                      sf::st_coordinates() |> as_tibble()),                      aes(label = teksti, x = X, y = Y))

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: want present multiple variables regions can use facets.

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: Facetting useful way present data multiple variables covering region. useful approach , lets say, data indicator two different time points want separate maps separate times points, shared scale. create random data two year titled population plot data using facet_wrap()-function.  However, often indicators want compare either different values (shared scale ideal), aggregated differently cover non-overlapping geographic region. may find patchwork useful example .
code: pop_data <- bind_rows(   tibble(     municipality_code = polygon$municipality_code   ) |>      mutate(population = rnorm(n = nrow(polygon), mean = 2000, sd = 250),            time = 2020),   tibble(     municipality_code = polygon$municipality_code   ) |>      mutate(population = rnorm(n = nrow(polygon), mean = 2000, sd = 250),            time = 2021)   ) pop_data #> # A tibble: 618 × 3 #>    municipality_code population  time #>                <int>      <dbl> <dbl> #>  1                 5      1391.  2020 #>  2                 9      1999.  2020 #>  3                10      2155.  2020 #>  4                16      2287.  2020 #>  5                18      1545.  2020 #>  6                19      1938.  2020 #>  7                20      1939.  2020 #>  8                35      1929.  2020 #>  9                43      1862.  2020 #> 10                46      2157.  2020 #> # ℹ 608 more rows pop_map <- right_join(polygon, pop_data)  ggplot(pop_map,         aes(fill = population)) +   geom_sf() +   facet_grid(~time) library(patchwork) p_municipalities <- ggplot(polygon, aes(fill = municipality_code)) +    geom_sf() +    theme(legend.position = "top") p_regions <- ggplot(polygon |> count(maakunta_code), aes(fill = maakunta_code)) +    geom_sf() +    theme(legend.position = "top") p_uusimaa <- ggplot(polygon_uusimaa, aes(fill = municipality_code)) +    geom_sf() +    theme(legend.position = "top")  (p_municipalities | p_regions) / p_uusimaa + plot_layout(nrow = 2, heights = c(1,0.6)) +   plot_annotation(title = "Combining multiple maps into a single (gg)plot")

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: Creating informative aesthetically pleasing maps always challenge recipe instant success. Colors important colorbrewer2.org can help . ggplot2 can use colorbrewer-palettes scale_fill_brewer, scale_fill_distiller, scale_fill_fermenter -functions. may want get rid grid well axis-labels -titles.
code: ggplot(polygon_uusimaa, aes(fill = municipality_code)) +   geom_sf(color = alpha("white", 1/3)) +   scale_fill_fermenter(palette = "YlGnBu") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text = element_blank(),         axis.title = element_blank(),         panel.grid = element_blank(),         legend.position = "top"         ) +   labs(title = "Municipality code",         fill = NULL)

title: Making maps using geofi-package
text: interactive maps Leaflet option. exploring datasets almost CRS try mapview. larger datasets, probably safer WebGL based mapdeck. , experienced leaflet following example using leaflet. Leaflet default projection EPSG:3857 WGS84, also known “Google Mercator” “Web Mercator, reproject geofi data plot using leaflet.
code: polygon_wgs84 <- sf::st_transform(x = polygon, crs = "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84") point_wgs84 <- sf::st_transform(x = point, crs = "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84") library(leaflet) # lets create a palette for polygon fill (municipality codes) pal <- leaflet::colorNumeric(palette = "Blues", domain = polygon_wgs84$municipality_code) # labels for localities labels <- sprintf( "%s (%s)", point_wgs84$teksti, point_wgs84$kuntatunnus ) |> lapply(htmltools::HTML) # popup for polygons popup <- sprintf( "%s (%s)", polygon_wgs84$municipality_name_fi, polygon_wgs84$municipality_code ) |> lapply(htmltools::HTML) EPSG3067 <- leaflet::leafletCRS(crsClass = "L.Proj.CRS", code = "EPSG:3067", proj4def = "+proj=utm +zone=35 +ellps=GRS80 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0 +units=m +no_defs", resolutions = 1.5^(25:15)) leaflet(polygon_wgs84, options = leafletOptions(worldCopyJump = F, crs = EPSG3067)) |> addProviderTiles(provider = providers$CartoDB.Positron) |> addPolygons(fillColor = ~pal(municipality_code), color = "black", weight = 1, opacity = 1, dashArray = "3", fillOpacity = 0.4, popup = popup, highlight = highlightOptions( weight = 2, color = "#666", dashArray = "", fillOpacity = 0.4, bringToFront = TRUE) ) |> addMarkers(data = point_wgs84, label = labels, clusterOptions = markerClusterOptions(), labelOptions = labelOptions(opacity = .7, style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "2px 4px"), textsize = "12px", direction = "auto"))

Download specific collections spatial data. Query geographic place names flexible filtering options. package handles API authentication, pagination, spatial filtering, coordinate reference system (CRS) transformations, making easy work Finnish spatial data R. use package, need API key National Land Survey Finland. Visit website obtain one. key, set R using:

title: Accessing Data from NLS OGC api
text: geofi package includes following key functions: ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections(): Retrieves list available collections Maastotietokanta, including titles descriptions. ogc_get_maastotietokanta(): Downloads specific collection Maastotietokanta, options CRS, spatial filtering, pagination. ogc_get_nimisto(): Queries Geographic Names dataset, allowing filtering search string, bounding box, parameters. fetch_ogc_api_mml(): internal function handles low-level API requests pagination (typically called directly users). functions return spatial data sf objects, compatible sf package spatial analysis visualization.

title: Accessing Data from NLS OGC api

title: Accessing Data from NLS OGC api
text: ogc_get_maastotietokanta() function downloads specific collection sf object. can customize output parameters like: collection: name collection (e.g., “hautausmaa” cemeteries). crs: coordinate reference system (EPSG:3067 EPSG:4326). limit: Maximum number features per request (NULL fetch ). bbox: bounding box spatial filtering (EPSG:4326). max_pages: Maximum number pages fetch paginating.

title: Spatial data manipulation and analysis using R and geofi-package
text: book , look chapter Coordinate Systems R first. using spatial data R necessary data coordinate reference system (CRS). can check CRS sf-object sf::st_crs()-function. data can obtain using geofi transformed automatically EPSG:3067. spatial data providers Finland provide data CRS. However, sometimes data correctly projected reproject using st_transform. Web maps like Google maps Leaflet use WGS 1984 geographic (long/lat) coordinate system fine added interactive feature, avoided plotting data maps elsewhere. especially case large northern countries like Finland. demonstrate effect lets reproject municipality data WGS 1984 (using EPSG code equivalent 4326) plot side side EPSG:3067  can see northern Finland larger right grid different.
code: library(geofi) library(sf) library(dplyr) muni <- get_municipalities() point <- municipality_central_localities() crs <- st_crs(muni) crs$input #> [1] "EPSG:3067" muni_4326 <- st_transform(muni, "EPSG:4326") crs <- st_crs(muni_4326) crs$input #> [1] "EPSG:4326"  library(ggplot2)    p1 <- ggplot(muni |> st_union()) +    geom_sf() +    labs(subtitle = "EPSG:3067") p2 <- ggplot(muni_4326 |> st_union()) +    geom_sf() +   labs(subtitle = "EPSG:4326") library(patchwork) wrap_plots(list(p1,p2), nrow = 1) +   plot_annotation(title = "Map of Finland in two different CRS")

Lets imagine need detailed view metropolitan area Greater Helsinki consist following municipalities: Espoo, Helsinki, Vantaa, Hyvinkää, Järvenpää, Kauniainen, Kerava, Kirkkonummi, Mäntsälä, Nurmijärvi, Pornainen, Sipoo, Tuusula Vihti. can subset data just using names municipalities.
code: greater_helsinki <- c('Espoo','Helsinki','Vantaa','Hyvinkää',                       'Järvenpää','Kauniainen','Kerava','Kirkkonummi',                       'Mäntsälä','Nurmijärvi','Pornainen','Sipoo','Tuusula','Vihti') greater_helsinki_polygon <- muni |> filter(municipality_name_fi %in% greater_helsinki)  ggplot(greater_helsinki_polygon) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = point |>              filter(teksti %in% toupper(greater_helsinki)))

code: bounding_box_polygon <- st_as_sfc(st_bbox(muni |> filter(municipality_name_fi %in% greater_helsinki)))  ggplot(st_intersection(bounding_box_polygon, muni)) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = point |> filter(teksti %in% toupper(greater_helsinki))) bounding_box_point <- st_as_sfc(st_bbox(point |> filter(teksti %in% toupper(greater_helsinki))))  ggplot(st_intersection(bounding_box_point, muni)) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = point |> filter(teksti %in% toupper(greater_helsinki)))

title: Spatial data manipulation and analysis using R and geofi-package
text: can download predefined grids Statistics Finland using get_statistical_grid get_population_grid() -functions geofi-package. data contains just geographical shape, also attribute data population etc. within grid cells. However, may need create custom grid, instance aggregate point data, can created st_make_grid() function. describes Marko Kallio Spatial data analysis R. creates regular grid bounding box ‘sf’ object. Can given certain cell size, number cells x y directions. ‘’ tells function kind regular grid wanted (polygons, corners, centers). Fishnets lines rather polygons can created simply casting polygons “LINESTRING”s. resulting polygon grid ‘sfc’ object, needs made ‘sf’ order us add ID-attribute. example pick northern Muonio municipality create custom 2km*4km grid top . Afterward aggregate number reindeer grid cell data.
code: muonio <- muni |> filter(municipality_name_fi == "Muonio")  grid_sf <- st_make_grid(muonio, cellsize = c(2000,4000), what="polygons") |>     st_sf()  grid_clip <- st_intersection(grid_sf, muonio) grid_clip$rank <- 1:nrow(grid_clip)  ggplot(grid_clip) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = rank), color = alpha("white", 1/3), size = 3) +   scale_fill_viridis_c() +   theme_minimal()

title: Spatial data manipulation and analysis using R and geofi-package
text: mathematics, Voronoi diagram partition plane regions close given set objects. Source: Wikipedia: Voronoi diagram Perhaps useful operation, worth taking look readily available sf function st_voronoi. case, creates layer polygons closest municipality central locality.
code: library(geofi) library(sf)  muni_voronoi <- municipality_central_localities() |>    st_union() |>   st_voronoi() |>    st_cast() |>    st_sf() |>    st_intersection(st_union(muni)) |>    mutate(rnk = 1:n())  ggplot(muni_voronoi) +    geom_sf(aes(fill = rnk)) +   geom_sf(data = municipality_central_localities(), shape = 4) +   scale_fill_fermenter(palette = "YlGnBu") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text = element_blank(),         axis.title = element_blank(),         panel.grid = element_blank(),         legend.position = "none")

title: Spatial data manipulation and analysis using R and geofi-package
text: Calculating distances certainly core geospatial analysis. exercise interested calculating distances municipality central localities Finland. expected, talking great circle distances , ie. crow flies type distances. can calculate distance matrices using st_distance()-function sf-package computes distances pairs geometries. geofi-package contains function municipality_central_localities() use calculate distances points. First need subset data replace original municipality name column (teksti) better latest municipality key. Let’s aim data structure municipality name code origin destination. get lets create loop calculates distance matrices municipality municipalities, assign data list finally bind data frames single data. Finally can draw two plots verify results. First let’s draw bar plot 20 municipality central localities nearest Helsinki  , lets find municipality central locality nearest center Finland. finally lets draw bar plot 20 furthest localities  last, need show distances also map.
code: kunta <- geofi::municipality_central_localities() |>     select(teksti,kuntatunnus) |>   mutate(kuntatunnus = as.integer(kuntatunnus)) |>   select(-teksti) |>   left_join(geofi::municipality_key_2025 |> select(municipality_code, municipality_name_fi),             by = c("kuntatunnus" = "municipality_code")) |>   rename(teksti = municipality_name_fi) kunta #> Simple feature collection with 309 features and 2 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 91954.76 ymin: 6638646 xmax: 701036.8 ymax: 7755601 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / TM35FIN(E,N) #> First 10 features: #>    kuntatunnus    teksti                 geometry #> 1          890   Utsjoki POINT (501086.5 7755601) #> 2          148     Inari POINT (522136.3 7616266) #> 3           47 Enontekiö POINT (362091.4 7589569) #> 4          273    Kolari POINT (362088.2 7471921) #> 5          976 Ylitornio POINT (350962.8 7359884) #> 6          732     Salla POINT (573395.9 7413832) #> 7          854     Pello POINT (366564.7 7409490) #> 8          578   Paltamo POINT (540087.8 7142933) #> 9          205   Kajaani   POINT (535577 7122153) #> 10         630   Pyhäntä POINT (467440.4 7107996) d_list <- list() kuntadatan_teksti_ja_kuntatunnus <- sf::st_drop_geometry(kunta) |>   select(teksti,kuntatunnus) for (i in 1:nrow(kunta)){   dist_tmp <- sf::st_distance(x = kunta[i,], y =  kunta)   tibble(origin_name = kunta[i,]$teksti,          origin_code = kunta[i,]$kuntatunnus) |>     bind_cols(kuntadatan_teksti_ja_kuntatunnus |> rename(destination_name = teksti,                                                           destination_code = kuntatunnus)) |>     mutate(dist = dist_tmp[1,]) -> d_list[[i]] } kunta_dist <- do.call("bind_rows", d_list) |>   mutate(dist = as.numeric(dist)) head(kunta_dist) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   origin_name origin_code destination_name destination_code    dist #>   <chr>             <int> <chr>                       <int>   <dbl> #> 1 Utsjoki             890 Utsjoki                       890      0  #> 2 Utsjoki             890 Inari                         148 140915. #> 3 Utsjoki             890 Enontekiö                      47 216532. #> 4 Utsjoki             890 Kolari                        273 315903. #> 5 Utsjoki             890 Ylitornio                     976 423236. #> 6 Utsjoki             890 Salla                         732 349334. ggplot(kunta_dist |>          filter(origin_name == "Helsinki") |>          arrange(dist) |> slice(1:20),        aes(x = dist, y = reorder(destination_name, dist), label = round(dist))) +          geom_col() + geom_text(aes(x = 1000), color = "white", hjust = 0) +   labs(title = "Nearest 20 municipality localities to Helsinki", x = "distance in meters") # We firt need the country map as a single polygon geofi::get_municipalities() |>    sf::st_union() |>    # then we need to compute the centroid of that polygon   sf::st_centroid() -> fin_centroid  # The let's find the nearest neighbour with distance <- st_distance(x = fin_centroid, y = kunta) kuntadatan_teksti_ja_kuntatunnus |>    mutate(dist = as.numeric(distance)) |>    arrange(dist) -> closest_to_center head(closest_to_center) #>       teksti kuntatunnus     dist #> 1 Siikalatva         791 13582.66 #> 2    Pyhäntä         630 17512.41 #> 3  Kärsämäki         317 33270.89 #> 4  Haapavesi          71 38730.91 #> 5      Vaala         785 50150.05 #> 6   Utajärvi         889 61041.41 furthest20 <- kunta_dist |>          filter(origin_name == closest_to_center[1,]$teksti) |>          arrange(desc(dist)) |> slice(1:20) ggplot(furthest20,        aes(x = dist, y = reorder(destination_name, dist), label = round(dist))) +   geom_col() + geom_text(aes(x = 10000), color = "white", hjust = 0) +   labs(title = paste("Furthest 20 municipality localities \nfrom the most central locality of ", closest_to_center[1,]$teksti), x = "distance in meters") sf_lahto <- kunta |>    filter(teksti %in% closest_to_center[1,]$teksti) |>   select(teksti) sf_paate <- kunta |>    filter(teksti %in% furthest20$destination_name) |>    select(teksti)  triplst <- list() for (i in 1:nrow(sf_paate)){ triplst[[i]] <- rbind(   sf_lahto,   sf_paate[i,] ) |>    summarize(m = mean(row_number()),do_union=FALSE) |>    st_cast("LINESTRING") } trips <- do.call("rbind", triplst)  ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = muni |> st_union(), alpha = .3) +   geom_sf(data = trips, color = "dim grey") +   geom_sf_label(data = sf_lahto, aes(label = teksti)) +   geom_sf_text(data = sf_paate, aes(label = teksti))

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: geofi package provides tools access spatial data Statistics Finland’s OGC API, including administrative boundaries, population data administrative units, population data statistical grid cells. vignette demonstrates use package’s core functions : Retrieve Finnish administrative area polygons (e.g., municipalities, regions). Fetch population data linked administrative units. Access population data statistical grid cells. package handles pagination, spatial filtering, coordinate reference system (CRS) transformations, delivering data sf objects compatible sf package spatial analysis visualization.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: geofi package includes following key functions accessing Statistics Finland data: ogc_get_statfi_area(): Retrieves administrative area polygons (e.g., municipalities, wellbeing areas) specified years scales. ogc_get_statfi_area_pop(): Fetches administrative area polygons associated population data, pivoted wide format. ogc_get_statfi_statistical_grid(): Retrieves population data statistical grid cells different resolutions (1km 5km). functions return spatial data sf objects, making easy integrate spatial analysis workflows R.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: ogc_get_statfi_area() function retrieves polygons Finnish administrative units, municipalities (kunta), wellbeing areas (hyvinvointialue), regions (maakunta). can customize output parameters like: year: year boundaries (2020–2022). scale: Map resolution (1:1,000,000 1:4,500,000). tessellation: Type administrative unit (e.g., kunta, hyvinvointialue). crs: Coordinate reference system (EPSG:3067 EPSG:4326). limit: Maximum number features (NULL ). bbox: Bounding box spatial filtering.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: Retrieve population data 2021. default, function returns regional breakdown available, users task filter regional breakdown interest. moment, can using regular expressions prefix variable areaStatisticalUnit_inspireId_localId. Following prefixes available "avi", "ely", "kunta", "maakunta", "seutukunta", "suuralue" Visualize share female population municpality (kunta) level.
code: pop_data <- ogc_get_statfi_area_pop(year = 2021, crs = 3067) ggplot(data=pop_data |>           filter(grepl("^kunta", areaStatisticalUnit_inspireId_localId))) +     geom_sf(aes(fill = female_percentage)) +     scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma") +     theme_minimal() +     labs(title = "Population by Administrative Area (2021)", fill = "share of females (%)")

what: Example: Population Data with Bounding Box
title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api

code: pop_south <- ogc_get_statfi_area_pop(year = 2021, bbox = bbox_finland_south, crs = 4326) ggplot(data=pop_south |> filter(grepl("^kunta", areaStatisticalUnit_inspireId_localId))) +     geom_sf(aes(fill = female_percentage)) +     scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma") +     theme_minimal() +     labs(title = "Population by Administrative Area (2021)", fill = "share of females (%)")

what: Step 3: Retrieving Population Data by Statistical Grid
title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: ogc_get_statfi_statistical_grid() function retrieves population data statistical grid cells 1km 5km resolution. Data returned EPSG:3067 (ETRS89 / TM35FIN). Parameters include: year: year data (2019–2021). resolution: Grid cell size (1000m 5000m). limit: Maximum number features (NULL ). bbox: Bounding box spatial filtering.

code: grid_data <- ogc_get_statfi_statistical_grid(year = 2021, resolution = 5000, bbox = bbox_finland_south) ggplot(grid_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = total_count), color = NA) +   scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "magma", trans='sqrt') +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Population by 5km Grid Cells (2021)", fill = "Population")

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: limit = NULL, fetch_ogc_api_statfi() function automatically paginates large datasets, fetching 10,000 features per request. ensures available data retrieved, even large administrative grid datasets.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: package includes robust error handling: Validates inputs (e.g., year, scale, tessellation, CRS, bounding box format). Provides informative error messages API failures invalid responses. Returns NULL warning data retrieved, helping users diagnose issues.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: functions support two CRS options: EPSG:3067 (ETRS89 / TM35FIN): default Finnish spatial data, suitable local analyses. EPSG:4326 (WGS84): Useful global compatibility web mapping. Note ogc_get_statfi_statistical_grid() fixed EPSG:3067, per API’s design.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: bbox parameter allows spatial filtering focus specific regions. Bounding box coordinates EPSG:4326 work crs EPSG:4326 EPSG:3067. Bounding box EPSG:3067 requires crs also set EPSG:3067 function argument. Example format: "18.797607,59.573288,30.476074,61.695082".

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api
text: Test Limits: large datasets (e.g., 1km grids), start small limit bbox estimate runtime fetching features. CRS Selection: Use EPSG:3067 Finnish data unless need EPSG:4326 compatibility systems. Check Tessellation Types: Verify valid tessellation options (kunta, hyvinvointialue, etc.) using ogc_get_statfi_area(). Inspect Output: Population data ogc_get_statfi_area_pop() ogc_get_statfi_statistical_grid() pivoted wide format. Check column names identify available variables.

title: Accessing Data from Statistics Finland OGC api

API key required, users can quickly retrieve visualize data using sf ggplot2. Try examples explore Finland’s spatial demographic datasets!

title: Access Finnish Geospatial Data
text: geofi-package can download geospatial data municipalities, zipcodes population statistical grids Statistics Finland WFS-api. addition, -board municipality keys aggregating municipality-level data higher level regional distributions based Statistics Finland classification API. examples data can access using geofi. Please closer look vignettes comprehensive use cases.
code: # install from CRAN install.packages("geofi")  # Install development version from GitHub remotes::install_github("ropengov/geofi") library(geofi) d1 <- get_municipalities(year = 2025) d2 <- get_zipcodes(year = 2025) d3 <- get_statistical_grid(resolution = 5) d4 <- get_population_grid(resolution = 5) d5 <- municipality_central_localities()  library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) theme_set(   theme_minimal(base_family = "Arial") +   theme(legend.position= "none",         axis.text = element_blank(),         axis.title = element_blank(),         panel.grid = element_blank()         ) ) p1 <- ggplot(d1, aes(fill = kunta)) + geom_sf(colour = alpha("white", 1/3)) + labs(subtitle = "municipalities") p2 <- ggplot(d1 |> count(maakunta_code), aes(fill = maakunta_code)) + geom_sf(colour = alpha("white", 1/3)) + labs(subtitle = "Aggregated municipality data \nat region (maakunta) level \n(one of many!)") p3 <- ggplot(d2, aes(fill = as.integer(posti_alue))) + geom_sf(colour = alpha("white", 1/3)) + labs(subtitle = "zipcodes") p4 <- ggplot(d3, aes(fill = nro)) + geom_sf(colour = alpha("white", 1/3)) + labs(subtitle = "statistical grid") p5 <- ggplot(d4, aes(fill = id_nro)) + geom_sf(colour = alpha("white", 1/3)) + labs(subtitle = "population grid") p6 <- ggplot(d5, aes(color = as.integer(kuntatunnus))) + geom_sf() + labs(subtitle = "Central municipality localities")  library(patchwork) wrap_plots(list(p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6), ncol = 3) +    patchwork::plot_annotation(title = "Spatial data in geofi-package")

what: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
text: Geocodes Finnish place names street addresses using National Land Survey Finland (NLS) geocoding REST API. function converts textual location descriptions spatial coordinates.

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
code: geocode(   search_string,   source = "interpolated-road-addresses",   crs = 3067,   lang = "fi",   size = NULL,   options = NULL,   api_key = getOption("geofi_mml_api_key") )

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
text: search_string Character. place name street address geocode (e.g., "Suomenlinna" "Mannerheimintie 100, Helsinki"). source Character. data source search . Must one : "interpolated-road-addresses" (default), "geographic-names", "addresses", "mapsheets-tm35", "cadastral-units". crs Character. coordinate reference system (CRS) output data, specified EPSG code. Must one "EPSG:3067" (ETRS-TM35FIN, default) "EPSG:4326" (WGS84). lang Character. language API response labels. Must one "fi" (Finnish, default), "sv" (Swedish), "en" (English). size Numeric NULL. maximum number results return. Must positive integer. NULL (default), API’s default size used. options Character NULL. Additional options pass API, specified single string (e.g., "focus.point.lat=60.1699&focus.point.lon=24.9384"). NULL (default), additional options included. See NLS geocoding API documentation valid options. api_key Character. API key authenticating NLS geocoding API. Defaults value stored options(geofi_mml_api_key). can obtain API key National Land Survey Finland website (see https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/en/rajapinnat/api-avaimen-ohje).

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
text: sf object containing geocoded locations points specified crs. results found, warning issued, empty sf object returned.

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
text: function uses NLS geocoding REST API convert place names street addresses spatial coordinates. supports multiple data sources, including interpolated road addresses, geographic names, cadastral units. function includes robust error handling: Retries failed requests 3 times transient network issues. Handles HTTP errors rate limits (HTTP 429). Validates inputs prevent common errors.

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
text: Markus Kainu markus.kainu@kapsi.fi

title: Geocode Finnish Place Names or Street Addresses — geocode
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set your API key options(geofi_mml_api_key = "your_api_key_here")  # Geocode a place name locations <- geocode(search_string = "Suomenlinna", source = "geographic-names") print(locations)  # Geocode a street address with a custom size and output CRS addresses <- geocode(   search_string = "Mannerheimintie 100, Helsinki",   source = "addresses",   crs = "EPSG:4326",   size = 5 ) print(addresses) } # }

what: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
text: Reverse geocodes geographic coordinates Finnish place names street addresses using National Land Survey Finland (NLS) geocoding REST API. function converts spatial points textual location descriptions.

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
code: geocode_reverse(   point,   boundary_circle_radius = NULL,   size = NULL,   layers = NULL,   sources = NULL,   return = "sf",   api_key = getOption("geofi_mml_api_key") )

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
text: point sf object POINT geometries, representing locations reverse geocode. input must EPSG:4326 (WGS84) CRS. boundary_circle_radius Numeric NULL. radius (meters) circular boundary around point limit search area. Must positive number. NULL (default), boundary radius applied. size Numeric NULL. maximum number results return per point. Must positive integer. NULL (default), API’s default size used. layers Character NULL. layers include search, specified comma-separated string (e.g., "address,poi"). NULL (default), API’s default layers used. See NLS geocoding API documentation valid layers. sources Character NULL. data sources search , specified comma-separated string (e.g., "geographic-names,addresses"). Must one "interpolated-road-addresses", "geographic-names", "addresses", "mapsheets-tm35", "cadastral-units". NULL (default), API’s default sources used. return Character. format returned data. Must one "sf" (default, returns sf object) "json" (returns list raw JSON responses). api_key Character. API key authenticating NLS geocoding API. Defaults value stored options(geofi_mml_api_key). can obtain API key National Land Survey Finland website (see https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/en/rajapinnat/api-avaimen-ohje).

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
text: return="sf", sf object containing reverse geocoded locations points EPSG:4326 (WGS84) CRS. return="json", list raw JSON responses API. results found point, warning issued, point may omitted results.

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
text: function uses NLS geocoding REST API convert geographic coordinates place names street addresses. supports multiple points single call allows filtering search radius, layers, sources, country. function includes robust error handling: Retries failed requests 3 times transient network issues. Handles HTTP errors rate limits (HTTP 429). Validates inputs prevent common errors.

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
text: Markus Kainu markus.kainu@kapsi.fi

title: Reverse Geocode Geographic Locations into Finnish Place Names or Addresses — geocode_reverse
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set your API key options(geofi_mml_api_key = "your_api_key_here")  # Create a point for Suomenlinna (in EPSG:4326)  # Reverse geocode to get place names print(places)  # Reverse geocode with a search radius and return raw JSON places_json <- geocode_reverse(   point = suomenlinna,   boundary_circle_radius = 1000,   return = "json" ) print(places_json) } # }

what: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
text: Downloads specific collection spatial data Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) using OGC API provided National Land Survey Finland (NLS).

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
code: ogc_get_maastotietokanta(   collection = "hautausmaa",   crs = 3067,   limit = NULL,   max_pages = 100,   bbox = NULL,   api_key = getOption("geofi_mml_api_key") )

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
text: collection Character. name collection download (e.g., "hautausmaa" cemeteries). Use ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections see available collections. crs Numeric Character. coordinate reference system (CRS) output data, specified EPSG code. Supported values 3067 (ETRS-TM35FIN, default) 4326 (WGS84). returned sf object transformed CRS. limit Numeric NULL. maximum number features retrieve single API request. NULL (default), available features fetched, potentially using pagination large collections. max_pages Numeric. maximum number pages fetch pagination limit=NULL. Defaults 100. Increase value large collections (e.g., "suo"), cautious long runtimes. bbox Character NULL. bounding box filter data, specified string format "minx,miny,maxx,maxy" (e.g., "24.5,60.1,25.5,60.5"). Coordinates must CRS API (EPSG:4326). NULL (default), spatial filter applied. api_key Character. API key authenticating Maastotietokanta OGC API. Defaults value stored options(geofi_mml_api_key). can obtain API key National Land Survey Finland website (see https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/en/rajapinnat/api-avaimen-ohje).

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
text: sf object containing spatial features specified collection, transformed requested crs.

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
text: function retrieves spatial data Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) OGC API, provided National Land Survey Finland (NLS). acts wrapper around lower-level API request function, adding user-friendly features like CRS transformation spatial filtering. Key features: Supports pagination large collections limit=NULL. Limits number pages fetched pagination using max_pages. Applies spatial filtering using bounding box (bbox). Transforms output specified CRS (crs). Validates inputs prevent common errors. see list available collections, use ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections. large collections (e.g., "suo"), function may fetch data pages 10,000 features . number pages exceeds max_pages, warning issued, features first max_pages pages returned. Increase max_pages retrieve features, aware may significantly increase runtime.

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
text: Markus Kainu markus.kainu@kapsi.fi

title: Download a Collection from the Maastotietokanta (Topographic Database) — ogc_get_maastotietokanta
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set your API key options(geofi_mml_api_key = "your_api_key_here")  # Download the "hautausmaa" (cemeteries) collection in EPSG:3067 cemeteries <- ogc_get_maastotietokanta(collection = "hautausmaa") print(cemeteries)  # Download the "suo" (bogs/marshes) collection with a higher page limit bogs <- ogc_get_maastotietokanta(   collection = "suo",   max_pages = 500 ) print(bogs)  # Download with a bounding box (in EPSG:4326) and transform to EPSG:4326 cemeteries_bbox <- ogc_get_maastotietokanta(   collection = "hautausmaa",   bbox = "24.5,60.1,25.5,60.5",   crs = 4326 ) print(cemeteries_bbox)  } # }

Fetch Maastotietokanta Collections — ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections
text: api_key Character. API key authenticating Maastotietokanta OGC API. Defaults value stored options(geofi_mml_api_key). can obtain API key Maanmittauslaitos (National Land Survey Finland) website.

title: Fetch Maastotietokanta Collections — ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections
text: data frame two columns: id: title collection. description: brief description collection.

title: Fetch Maastotietokanta Collections — ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections
text: function queries Maastotietokanta OGC API retrieve metadata available collections spatial data. API provided National Land Survey Finland (Maanmittauslaitos). function requires valid API key, can provided directly set via options(geofi_mml_api_key). function includes error handling: retries failed requests 3 times transient network issues server errors (HTTP 500–599) exponential backoff. handles rate limits (HTTP 429) respecting Retry-header. validates API response ensure expected data present.

title: Fetch Maastotietokanta Collections — ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set your API key options(geofi_mml_api_key = "your_api_key_here")  # Fetch the list of collections collections <- ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections() print(collections)  # Alternatively, provide the API key directly collections <- ogc_get_maastotietokanta_collections(api_key = "your_api_key_here") print(collections) } # }

what: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
text: Queries Geographic Names (Nimistö) OGC API retrieve spatial data place names provided National Land Survey Finland (NLS).

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
code: ogc_get_nimisto(   search_string = NULL,   collection = "placenames",   crs = 3067,   limit = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   custom_params = NULL,   api_key = getOption("geofi_mml_api_key") )

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
text: search_string Character NULL. search string filter place names (e.g., "kainu"). search case-insensitive. NULL (default), search filter applied, place names retrieved (subject limit parameter). collection Character NULL. name collection places, place names map names Geographic Names Register provided National Land Survey Finland search performed . Supported values placenames, mapnames, placenames_simple crs Numeric Character. coordinate reference system (CRS) output data, specified EPSG code. Supported values 3067 (ETRS-TM35FIN, default) 4326 (WGS84). returned sf object transformed CRS. limit Numeric. maximum number features retrieve single API request. Defaults 10. Set NULL fetch available features (potentially using pagination large datasets). bbox Character NULL. bounding box filter data, specified string format "minx,miny,maxx,maxy" (e.g., "24.5,60.1,25.5,60.5"). Coordinates must CRS API (EPSG:4326). NULL (default), spatial filter applied. custom_params Character NULL. Additional query parameters append API URL, specified single string (e.g., "attribute='value'"). NULL (default), additional parameters included. api_key Character. API key authenticating Geographic Names OGC API. Defaults value stored options(geofi_mml_api_key). can obtain API key National Land Survey Finland website (see https://www.maanmittauslaitos.fi/en/rajapinnat/api-avaimen-ohje).

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
text: sf object containing spatial features (place names) Geographic Names dataset, transformed requested crs. features found, warning issued, empty sf object may returned.

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
text: function retrieves spatial data place names Geographic Names (Nimistö) OGC API, provided National Land Survey Finland (NLS). supports filtering search string (case-insensitive), spatial filtering using bounding box, limiting number returned features. Key features: Supports pagination large datasets limit=NULL. Applies spatial filtering using bounding box (bbox). Transforms output specified CRS (crs). Validates inputs prevent common errors.

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
text: Markus Kainu markus.kainu@kapsi.fi

title: Query Geographic Names (Nimistö) from the National Land Survey of Finland — ogc_get_nimisto
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set your API key options(geofi_mml_api_key = "your_api_key_here")  # Search for place names containing "kainu" in EPSG:3067 places <- ogc_get_nimisto(search_string = "kainu") print(places)  # Search with a bounding box (in EPSG:4326) and transform to EPSG:4326 places_bbox <- ogc_get_nimisto(   search_string = "kainu",   bbox = "24.5,60.1,25.5,60.5",   crs = 4326 ) print(places_bbox)  # Fetch all place names (no search filter) with a custom limit all_places <- ogc_get_nimisto(   search_string = NULL,   limit = 100 ) print(all_places) } # }

title: Retrieve Finnish Administrative Area Polygons — ogc_get_statfi_area

title: Retrieve Finnish Administrative Area Polygons — ogc_get_statfi_area

title: Retrieve Finnish Administrative Area Polygons — ogc_get_statfi_area
text: year Integer. Year administrative borders. Options: 2020, 2021, 2022. Default: 2022. scale Integer. Map scale/resolution. Options: 1000 (1:1,000,000), 4500 (1:4,500,000). Default: 4500. tessellation Character NULL. Type administrative unit. Options: "avi", "ely", "hyvinvointialue", "kunta", "maakunta", "seutukunta", "suuralue", "tyossakayntialue", "vaalipiiri". NULL, retrieves units. Default: NULL. crs Integer. Coordinate Reference System (EPSG code). Options: 3067 (ETRS89 / TM35FIN), 4326 (WGS84). Default: 3067. limit Integer NULL. Maximum number features retrieve. NULL, retrieves available features. Default: NULL. bbox Character NULL. Bounding box spatial filtering format "xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax" (specified CRS). Default: NULL.

title: Retrieve Finnish Administrative Area Polygons — ogc_get_statfi_area
text: sf object containing requested spatial data, NULL data retrieved.
